44659CC0EC24430BA84B34CD372B653F.description:
Discuss the assumptions and limitations of conclusions drawn from sample data or
graphical/numerical summaries of data

D7C70EC084E44671B74A2009CD230E73.description: Discuss misconceptions and misuses of statistics

4CBBE50A9CBC47C4826EF87238CBD384.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of different graphical displays in representing data

74225476BC224CC595F521DDB5D75CF5.description:
Select, calculate and interpret appropriate summary statistics to describe aspects
of univariate data. Central tendency: mean (including of a grouped frequency
distribution), median, mode. Variability: range

404819FE211C4513ADD64E0275AD5FFB.description:
Select, draw and interpret appropriate graphical displays of univariate data, including pie
charts, bar charts, line plots, histograms (equal intervals), ordered stem and leaf plots,
and ordered back-to-back stem and leaf plots

BED847A9950549AF870D5663EE575C6B.description:
Plan and implement a method to generate and/or source unbiased, representative data,
and present this data in a frequency table

23F7D963CC6B46699E5961918D2CFFEB.description:
Use relative frequency as an estimate of the probability of an event, given experimental
data, and recognise that increasing the number of times an experiment is repeated
generally leads to progressively better estimates of its theoretical probability

03DF307DA2CB451C9764F0DA66E0304F.description:
Use the principle that, in the case of equally likely outcomes, the probability of an event
is given by the number of outcomes of interest divided by the total number of outcomes

6B37FB464BF8424CADE6C5B74116ACF8.description:
Demonstrate understanding that probability is a measure on a scale of 0-1 of how likely
an event (including an everyday event) is to occur

4F6E890F667243A8A8D0D5EC38867B86.description: Use the fundamental principle of counting to solve authentic problems

EB56A6D1B0EA4F958F0C589B5623A3AF.description:
Generate a sample space for an experiment in a systematic way, including tree diagrams
for successive events and two-way tables for independent events

43BBA762175645D0B2CB57AF8D1BE21E.description:
Make connections between the shape of a graph and the story of a phenomenon,
including identifying and interpreting maximum and minimum points

31A94196414C4772BC1C15F6CA22CA7A.description:
Use graphical methods to find and interpret approximate solutions of equations
such as f(x) = g(x)
and approximate solution sets of inequalities such as f(x) < g(x)

3EB22EAA01A84D3FBDB165560F32490E.description:
Represent and interpret functions in different ways—graphically (for x ∈ ℕ, ℤ, and
ℝ, [continuous functions only], as appropriate), diagrammatically, in words, and
algebraically — using the language and notation of functions (domain, range, co-domain,
f(x) = , f :x ⟼ , and y =) (drawing the graph of a function given its algebraic expression is
limited to linear and quadratic functions at OL)

80581A42D454424A989C00ACD1A0CDB7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the concept of a function

30806C2247C04EF0B1FFCE40C76EA501.description:
Apply the relationship between operations and an understanding of the order of
operations including brackets and exponents to change the subject of a formula

220F09A978D44253A8A94407801AEF36.description: Generate quadratic equations given integer roots

2FCD7EBD46F747149B10C02976E14034.description:
Linear inequalities in one variable of the form g(x) < k , and graph the solution sets on the
number line for x ∈ ℕ, ℤ, and ℝ

42F4E7B9D546409098BA264F9F3F9116.description:
Simultaneous linear equations in two variables with coefficients and solutions in ℤ
or in ℚ

7D960E642B3B454CA07067DDB681EB5D.description:
Quadratic equations in one variable with coefficients and solutions in ℤ or
coefficients in ℚ and solutions in ℝ

6D2573358B9A4657BA395DA27B77101F.description: Linear equations in one variable with coefficients in ℚ and solutions in ℤ or in ℚ

8754389613E144D9BED50A11438E16DA.description:
Select and use suitable strategies (graphic, numeric, algebraic, trial and improvement,
working backwards) for finding solutions

672C89BC79EB4A6FA6C066461E097456.description:
x2
 – a2 and a2 x2 – b2 y2, where a, b ∈ ℤ

F36C0A3D5BEB4820BD984604C68253FF.description:

 + bx; x2
 + bx + c; and ax2 + bx + c, where b, c, d ∈ ℤ and a ∈ ℕ

5362B9FA52AC4C13860EF0F13C490C07.description: sx – ty + tx – sy, where s, t ∈ ℤ

370BBE2DB4D84199A3829576A28A21FD.description: Axy + byz, where a, b ∈ ℤ

7488B65A3CB8405B94B5439AA9D4455F.description:
Flexibly convert between the factorised and expanded forms of algebraic expressions of
the form

3BB48C9C79F946E6B74B7D9E1BA80C63.description:
Divide quadratic and cubic expressions by linear expressions, where all coefficients are
integers and there is no remainder

98516CBF138F49A5AE905B53A46DFF64.description: (ax + b) (cx + d) and (ax + b) (cx2 + dx + e), where a, b, c, d, e ∈ ℤ

5F6E766C5CF94D369DFEDF5D87614A6B.description:

 + cx + d), where a, b, c, d ∈ ℤ

56E5675D74C24956BFE84B055A18D6C5.description: Expressions of the form a / (bx + c), where a, b, c ∈ ℤ

553201BA04924AFAA2BBC4238EF6545F.description: Quadratic expressions in one variable with coefficients in ℤ

0F5842C95B8E45F89EE64C8098E70B2B.description: Linear expressions in one or more variables with coefficients in ℚ

62664E50B71446558F127C07260161D0.description:
Apply the properties of arithmetic operations and factorisation to generate equivalent
expressions

684E3A75C4EF433FA7038470A2ED36D7.description: Use the concept of equality to generate and interpret equations

A412F8E60F054177A667D565A401D47E.description: Find the value of expressions given the value of the variables

46883593A0EB48A3BC0CFB0A9808ECE5.description: Generate and interpret expressions in which letters stand for numbers

9E386C4B6BD74C1F81847014743736AE.description: Investigate situations in which letters stand for quantities that are variable

C50FCF4EB4D047BA8E6FB44FFF400A7D.description:
Categorise patterns as linear, non-linear, quadratic, and exponential (doubling
and tripling) using their defining characteristics as they appear in the different
representations

5B91AB2663DD46C2952F32939CE59C8A.description:
Generate a generalised expression for linear and quadratic patterns in words and
algebraic expressions and fluently convert between each representation

5FF0B898EBF147A2A173AEF3F0841D86.description: Represent these patterns and relationships in tables and graphs

ABBDB3B5B1EF4C01A0C1CFC66E5419E5.description:
Investigate patterns and relationships (linear, quadratic, doubling and tripling) in number,
spatial patterns and real-world phenomena involving change

8A77476D67AF4DC0AFE33AB6D5F937FD.description: Draw the axes of symmetry in shapes

BA0A734EF4BC4002AFD18C6A2A7F6C51.description:
Recognise and draw the image of points and objects under translation, central symmetry,
axial symmetry, and rotation

7B30F3936C95425AACB4FD98B81C8F21.description:
Find and interpret the equation of a line in the form y = mx + c; y – y1
 = m(x – x1
); and
ax + by + c = 0 (for a, b, c, m, x1
, y1 ∈ ℚ); including finding the slope, the y intercept, and
other points on the line

F91BD33126884568A82E87ACF23ECB23.description:
Draw graphs of line segments and interpret such graphs in context, including discussing
the rate of change (slope) and the y intercept

923E2303F13E40BCA8597818D7A4CB88.description:
Find and interpret: distance, midpoint, slope, point of intersection, and slopes of parallel
and perpendicular lines

0EBD652EAB6148CF920C93B71720B345.description: Investigate properties of points, lines and line segments in the co-ordinate plane

43CD89D7356C4FC8A7A5C1513EC8279A.description:
Evaluate and use trigonometric ratios (sin, cos, and tan, defined in terms of right-angled
triangles) and their inverses, involving angles between 0° and 90° at integer values and in
decimal form

3E24877E9C884D8D980E4AF386A7122B.description:
Display understanding of the proofs of theorems 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 14, 15, and 13, 19; and
of corollaries 3, 4, and 1, 2, 5 (full formal proofs are not examinable

A455348CFD2C4C1BABCD777FF727EF23.description: Create and evaluate proofs of geometrical propositions

0981FBFBAF134C38B9301E24B957930E.description: Use and explain the terms: theorem, proof, axiom, corollary, converse, and implies

022D622B2B76439D8E7256189B79A08A.description:
Theorems 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 13, 14, 15 and 11, 12, 19, and appropriate converses,
including relevant operations involving square roots

EDEC53E4DCC3476B83B72ABADF040DD3.description:
Recall and use the concepts, axioms, theorems, corollaries and converses, specified in
Geometry for Post-Primary School Mathematics (section 9 for OL and section 10 for HL)

A01082B0BDB44C63A42A8F461FDEF9AB.description:
Perform constructions 1 to 15 in Geometry for Post-Primary School Mathematics
(constructions 3 and 7 at HL only)

0AD6DBDEAC3E4129BC8BD89CBABD2F30.description: Investigate the concept of proof through their engagement with geometry

B6DB7884E94846A391064E69E54B007E.description:
Find the surface area and curved surface area (as appropriate) of rectangular solids,
cylinders, triangular-based prisms, spheres, and combinations of these

2590164FFB9A4CBD998599B00650EA4F.description:
Find the volume of rectangular solids, cylinders, triangular-based prisms, spheres, and
combinations of these, including relevant operations involving pi

61F571D565C64A68ADCD3108D63646FB.description:
Find the perimeter and area of plane figures made from combinations of discs, triangles,
and rectangles, including relevant operations involving pi

E71B7EA7040B48E88EBD666B58A51154.description: Draw and interpret nets of rectangular solids, prisms (polygonal bases), cylinders

B783C7BA0E6C444EBC619BC8036AA52A.description: Calculate, interpret, and apply units of measure and time

F24E8AE8FA25444BA92B1CE5BBAAF742.description:
Investigate whether the set operations of intersection, union, and difference are
commutative and/or associative

A1652C413C054E7790A22FC73BBBD089.description:
Perform the operations of intersection and union on 2 sets and on 3 sets, set difference,
and complement, including the use of brackets to define the order of operations

E6F87BBD2EC4434DA468649DBC098508.description:
Use and understand suitable set notation and terminology, including null set, Ø, subset,
 , complement, element, ∈, universal set, cardinal number, #, intersection, ∩, union, ∪,
set difference, \ , ℕ, ℤ, ℚ, ℝ, and ℝ\ℚ

A345ADFCDA714ADFB694E4FB85DD9916.description:
Define sets by listing their elements, if finite (including in a 2-set or 3-set Venn diagram),
or by generating rules that define them

ABD2A4AFEBC341CF8ED18DCB79FFB97E.description:
Understand the concept of a set as a well-defined collection of elements, and that set
equality is a relationship where two sets have the same elements

A69CB76BD9424FDE9F178F8DF456EF12.description: explore the concept of a set

3731109CA793410EB18C844BE675C282.description:
Analyse numerical patterns in different ways, including making out tables and graphs, and
continue such patterns

D7BA95C656494A24A45EBF490B843D71.description:
Solve problems involving proportionality including those involving currency conversion
and those involving average speed, distance, and time

2D35229BBCE54F7997EEA3145EA91F83.description: Use absolute and relative comparison where appropriate

364C8F6EB4BE4CF19608760204D7605C.description:
Solve money-related problems including those involving bills, VAT, profit or loss, % profit
or loss (on the cost price), cost price, selling price, compound interest for not more than
3 years, income tax (standard rate only), net pay (including other deductions of specified
amounts), value for money calculations and judgements, mark up (profit as a % of cost
price), margin (profit as a % of selling price), compound interest, income tax and net pay
(including other deductions)

A1E01FD5162F4CA88EC0F9808A83C353.description: Use and understand ratio and proportion

58C3ED49F7CD4C5AB0F575B52E20F7CC.description: Flexibly convert between fractions, decimals, and percentages

24F38860388F4009B30354A9DA178E29.description: Investigate equivalent representations of rational numbers

E6EEC07085154A9687E5486914E57E96.description:
Convert the number p in decimal form to the form a × 10n, where 1 ≤ a < 10, n ∈ ℤ, p ∈ ℚ,
and p ≥ 1 and 0 < p < 1

BBE1251C76454100AF0C28F87A5AB590.description:
Present numerical answers to the degree of accuracy specified, for example, correct to
the nearest hundred, to two decimal places, or to three significant figures

A2614C8DBF8B4638B885054181D67436.description:
Calculate and interpret factors (including the highest common factor), multiples
(including the lowest common multiple), and prime numbers

AD1B4FC009DD4A5CBB0179FBDAE58241.description:
Correctly use the order of arithmetic and index operations including the use of
brackets

8A6CFA2BB3DF4C91BC1C8740F1E374D5.description:
Generalise numerical relationships involving operations involving numbers written
in index form

3E9C249DC88449A7A4403248171E0D69.description: Flexibly translate between whole numbers and index representation of numbers

D4333B1A043047BEBF60AD71B1D809A8.description:
Explore numbers written as ab
 (in index form) so that they can:

558A0B634A5C4A75A1F93BC14BE9AD1E.description:
Perform the operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division and
understand the relationship between these operations and the properties: commutative,
associative and distributive in ℕ, ℤ, and ℚ and in ℝ\ℚ , including operating on surds

A993DDAFDED74BC8AE72088E81995D9D.description:
Represent the operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division in ℕ, ℤ, and
ℚ using models including the number line, decomposition, and accumulating groups of
equal size

CBAEA04B09A14CBB94B5592C40A6748F.description: Investigate the representation of numbers and arithmetic operations

16EE77C452CB49B9BA4425FEF84EFB75.description:
Communicate mathematics effectively: justify their
reasoning, interpret their results, explain their conclusions,
and use the language and notation of mathematics to
express mathematical ideas precisely

666ABA61CE7A4115993260438D2D7231.description: Generate and evaluate mathematical arguments and proofs

6AF9F7C6FC8140A7BA68F38BC6CA5C43.description:
Generate general mathematical statements or conjectures
based on specific instances

A9B250131EFE4830B80E7EB6CE4B6AB8.description:
Evaluate different possible solutions to a problem, including
evaluating the reasonableness of the solutions, and
exploring possible improvements and/or limitations of the
solutions (if any)

F2A39D90EF22471CBC7FD255AE689613.description:
Interpret their solution to a problem in terms of the original
question

044A68D2C46C4D74A5F0034F0B389287.description:
Apply their knowledge and skills to solve a problem,
including decomposing it into manageable parts and/or
simplifying it using appropriate assumptions

4D41A9B0F37544BC93A4DF917477F1EA.description:
Make sense of a given problem, and if necessary
mathematise a situation

8AC58D6BD3A9499EB2DBF82BDC70786E.description: Make connections between mathematics and the real world

6209BDBE61F54C75AE30C820E60866DB.description: Make connections within and between strands

8842FADFAECF4AEFB9D2F262C4BCB37F.description:
Represent a mathematical situation in a variety of different
ways, including: numerically, algebraically, graphically,
physically, in words; and to interpret, analyse, and compare
such representations

CFB9832F54A3413A9D45CC36C1ADF625.description:
Recognise that equality is a relationship in which two
mathematical expressions have the same value

5BB34FABAFB048AE8F317A6BCB26C498.description:
Apply the procedures associated with each strand accurately,
effectively, and appropriately

F280AE7FC6A7481DA3CAE96A9AF78715.description:
Recall and demonstrate understanding of the fundamental
concepts and procedures that underpin each strand
